title: Italic sans
content:
Okay, I'm sure I know this one, but it has gotten lost somewhere in my memory... It's the italic sans used in ReadyMade, and it has a double-story a, a semi-slab on the i, and the f drops below the baseline. It's _almost_ like Officina Sans Italic or Corpid Office Italic, except for that a. Anyone?

Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [instore300\_fplan1.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021051825/http:/typophile.com/files/instore300_fplan1.gif) | 5.38 KB |
| [instore300\_tote1.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021051825/http:/typophile.com/files/instore300_tote1.gif) | 4.28 KB |
author: Cassie

comments.content: That reminds me of [Xavier Dupré](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021051825/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Xavier%20Dupr%C3%A9)’s work – but I have no idea what it could be.
Just talked to an editor I know at ReadyMade. It's [Neue Sans Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021051825/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/foundry/ourtype/N/) from OurType (André Leonart).

For Extra Credit:

Also, Freight Micro and Clarendon.

Mikey :-)

Half a credit!

The numbers/figures aren’t Clarendon, Mikey ;-)
Are they Farao? Oooh I love that one. It's so yummy. The Farao numbers are surprisingly "normal" looking, though...
